intro: Rosa mollis f. inflagrans, commonly known as the soft rose or the silky rose, is a botanical variant of the species Rosa mollis. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy foliage and pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is native to the eastern United States and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its unique foliage and delicate flowers make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
